Description: String of 29 green (?) glazed composition or decayed glass beads of irregular fusiform shape, some of them having a yellow end.
Curator's comments: See W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72 : "A large number of blue-glazed amulets and beads, &c., were found in the camp, and a selection of these will be kept together in the British Museum to show the style of known work of the twenty-sixth dynasty".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.86, p.187, pl.29)
Condition: poor (some beads worn, broken or / and incomplete)
